declarations.comments: type alias for a Nodes Name
declarations.title: Id

declarations.comments:
Dot-Node
example :
```purescript
Node "e" [Margin 3, Label "some label"]
```
is turned into: `e [margin=3, label="some label"];`
declarations.title: Node

declarations.comments:
get a nodes id
example:
```purescript
nodeId (Node "e" [Label "foo"]) == "e"
```
declarations.title: nodeId

declarations.comments:
change Nodes id to a new one; keeing the old id as the label
example: `mapNodeId (\a -> a+"!") (Node "e" []) == Node "e!" [Label "e"]`
declarations.title: changeNodeId

declarations.comments:
egde from id to id
`toText $ Edge "a" "b" []` == `a -> b []`
option for different arrows is missing
declarations.title: Edge

declarations.comments:
```purescript
"a" =*> "b" $ [ Edge.FillColor red ]
```
Forward edge with attributes

```purescript
"a" <*= "b" $ [ Edge.FillColor red ]
```
Backward edge with attributes

```purescript
"a" =*= "b" $ [ Edge.FillColor red ]
```
Normal edge with attibutes
graph can either be a graph or digraph
declarations.title: Graph

declarations.comments:
create graph from Nodes and Edges
example: `graphFromElements [Node "e" [], Node "d" []] [Edge "e" "f"]`
declarations.title: graphFromElements

declarations.comments: `a` is a type that can be represented by a Dot-Graph
declarations.title: GraphRepr

declarations.comments: `a` is a type that has a representation in the dot language
declarations.title: DotLang
